name: Carter Dome

trails_config.name: Nineteen Mile Brook Loop
trails_config.description: Ascends alongside a scenic brook to the high-altitude Carter Notch Hut before climbing the steep western face of the Dome.
trails_config.parking_info: 19 Mile Brook Trailhead, NH-16, Gorham, NH

current_conditions.ai_summary: One of New Hampshire's premier peaks, Carter Dome rises to 4832 feet. It is known for its rugged terrain and panoramic vistas.
risk_factors: Check local trail conditions before departing.
Start early to avoid afternoon storms.

generated_description:
The Experience

Standing at 4832 feet, Carter Dome is a standout peak in New Hampshire. Known for its rugged and challenging terrain, it offers a quintessential hiking experience.

The Challenge

Hikers often choose the **Nineteen Mile Brook Loop**, a **10.2 mile** route gaining significant elevation. As part of the **NH48 4000-Footers**, it draws peak-baggers from across the region.

Peak Bagging Logic

**Peak Bagging Opportunity:** Consider connecting this hike with **South Carter Mountain**, which is just 1.1 miles away. Linking these peaks is a popular way to maximize your day on the trail.
